reviews.text: Service was excellent! Room was small but comfortable.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights for R & R. Used the KAL limo buses from Incheon airport, 15,000 won. Efficient and comfortable. Stopped right in front of the lower lobby door. Hotel reception was polite and efficient. Check-in was quick. The room was a nice size, bed so comfortable and the bathroom amenities (Hermes brand soaps and lotions) was a nice touch. We requested a computer in the room, and as platinum member, it was brought in at no charge. There was 2 bottles of complimentary water plus nespresso coffee and teas in the room that were refilled every day. Breakfast down in the ARIA restaurant was included. Many selections. It was quite busy when we stayed here. Had one breakfast in the executive lounge, limited sections but was sufficient to satisfy our morning hunger. Also visited the lounge at the evening happy hour, thought the refreshment choices and the wines served was excellent. Westin Chosun is conveniently located in an area of many shopping and restaurants. The subway station is close by but it is a nice walk to many destinations. If you want to exchange money, do it at the Namdemun market which is close by. You can get a better rate there, many places to change money , so get some prices. Overall a very relaxing stay in Seoul, will be back again.
reviews.title: Rest and relaxation

reviews.text: I have been returning to Westin Chosun for 25+ years and still find that no other hotels in Seoul come close; I will sometimes choose Grand Hyatt for its pool in July, Shilla if I have a car and a driver for the stay, Park Hyatt for meetings in Kangnam, but my first choice is Chosun. Korea has changed much, and the hotel has been renovated over the years with a cool lobby, great indoor pool (love the spa with digital temp display!) etc, but the service is consistently good (the doorman took my wet umbrella, shook it dry and put it in a plastic bag for me..), the young concierge team is so helpful (thanks Caylee for my Jeju rsv), and i always seem to get a room facing the lovely temple garden with the mountains beyond - it still feels like coming home!
reviews.title: Still the best in Seoul!

reviews.text: Will keep this short and sweet. Just got back from a 6 night stay at the westin chosun and a 5 night stay at the park hyatt. Very different places. For me and my two young kids (8 &3), we liked the westin better. just as a reference, I'm a starwood gold and hyatt platinum.
reviews.title: Great place and location

reviews.text: of note. the westin is in the myeondong district. It is very close to the corner store (pick up small food items) and lotte department store, but more importantly to the myeondong area which is very lively and fun especially at night. Everything from street food vendors and small nick nacks for the kids, it is a good time. We really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, excellent amenities, facilities

reviews.text: I spent three days at Seoul and choose this hotel. Hyatt was not available and was my first option. However i was not let down at all. Great location, pleasant staff, big rooms full equipped (nespresso cafe machine and I-phone included). I was provided a room in 17th floor with spectacular views.
reviews.title: Wonderful
Great location poor service and terrible bathrooms
reviews.text: Pool is long enough to practise swimming, one sauna per gender, gym, many services. If you do not want to have lunch or dinner in hotel, there are several restaurant around and a couple of starbucks and seven eleven really close to hotel if you do not take breakfast (which was more eastern than western, but fine).

I always check out after early breakfast to avoid queues and go up to room and make luggage. . 5 mintes after having paid the bill, the housekeeping knock the door to make room and reception staff phoned me if there were any problems as I have made checked out, I explained it and no problem. So One advise if you decide to check out earlier and not leave at this time let the staff know that you will still stay a bit more time in your room
reviews.title: Chosun is still the same - Poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room has been updated nice enough. Bathrooms are tiny and bad design as floods whenever shower - not just us as wood door frame is damp and rotting. Staff service is lacking because there is nevervany staff around on the front desk only one or two people when massive queue waiting for service, never anyone on the doors to help get us a taxi or help us out of one. Its a great location though and havent used the gym or pool yet but the poor staffing really lets this so called 5 star down. And whats with the 22000 won wifi charge daily honestly thats just a rip off. Doubt we will bother staying here again as over priced for what you get.
reviews.title: Politeness of Westin-Seoul
Great business hotel
reviews.text: I returned to Chosun after staying at Lotte and Intercontinental Coex for the past 6 years, only to find much has not changed. I am only Starwood gold as ICH (Platinum Ambassador) and Marriott (Gold), and Hyatt (Platinum) all treat their members much much better, and our Korean travel agent has a great rate with Lotte. On arrival, I asked if an upgrade was given and was told "no you are only gold and it is reserved for our platinum guests even though you were once a VIP at this hotel. However we will let you check in 2 hours early at 1pm - wow - big deal and an insult." I was given a room similar to that from 6 years ago with the same decor and while clean, it was a standard small room.

reviews.title: Perfect hotel in the most central area of Seoul
reviews.text: I've stayed at Executive flr with my husband for a wedding anniversary occasion on last April, the service was great and staffs were friendly & helpful.

We got a complementary wine, cheese and a box of chocolate from the hotel, it wasn't expensive one nor big but good enough to feel that we were treated well for my special occasion. And the executive lounge at 20th was awesome! The foods are fantastic, cozy and relaxing ambience. Strongly recommend to staying at executive floor just to enjoy the lounge haha

reviews.title: Convenient location, excellent services

reviews.text: This is one of the original five star, luxury hotels in Seoul. With the boom in the economy, many have followed in recent years and often this poses a difficulty for the 'old' hotel - which can then lag behind in decor, technology and innovation. Not so the case with The Westin - which remains at the top of its game. You can tell there has been extensive refurbishment over the years, as the product looks super throughout. Smart, stylish Lobby, matches the impecible staff and service. The rooms are a generous size, with everything you would expect from a five star hotel (my only complaint would be that they charge for WiFi). There is a great range of restaurants and bars and although the pool/gym was being refurbished when I was there - alternatives were in place to keep guests happy. The Executive Floor offers a nice private lounge environment - perfect for breakfast, business meetings, or a sunset drink. The location is also superb - being close to both the business districts and Royal Palaces. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Stick with the established player in the market - they won't put a foot wrong!
reviews.title: Great example of luxury evolving with the times
